Hello,

Thank you very much for your reply.

I have now solved the problem. It wasn't actually due to the system parameters for the passwords, but rather the user type. It had accidentally been changed to тАЬsystemтАЭ instead of тАЬserviceтАЭ for some of the FF IDs.

 

Best regards
Marco

entry.title: Re: Declaration 390 - EC Sales List Romania
entry.content:
Hello @JAS3311 

Thank you for your inquiry about setting up and managing Declaration 390 (EC Sales List) for Romania in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

Core Configuration and Process.

  • The main setup for Declaration 390 is carried out using the Configuration for Romania Declaration 390 activity in Central Business Configuration (CBC).
  • Tax codes and EU codes mapping required for the report are managed within Manage Tax Items for Legal Reporting. You can view and adjust how tax codes relate to Declaration 390тАЩs box/group structure there. This ensures that your transactions are correctly classified under the distinct EU codes (L, T, A, P, S) as per legal requirements.
  • To process the declaration, utilise the Run Statutory Reports app. Select the RO_DCL_RECAP_390 report, filter by the period and other criteria, and review the generated results. The Manage Tax Items step ensures accurate mapping and content of each report field.
  • With the recent VAT changes in Romania (August 2025), ensure that your tax codes are current in your system's tax setup. This will guarantee that your report displays the correct totals and classifications.

Notes:

  • The total fields' content in the VIES 390 declaration is based on the tax code/EU code mapping and underlying transactional data. Manual adjustments to these totals within the declaration application are not supported; updates must be made at the transaction or configuration level..
  • For detailed instructions and compliance, please refer to the official SAP documentation:
    • Romania Declaration 390 тАУ SAP Help Portal
    • Configuration for Romania Declaration 390

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Proportional Integration - Proportion Shares - Group...
entry.content:
Hi @Fch3_ 

Thank you for your question.

For consolidation units using the proportional consolidation method in SAP Group Reporting, you need to ensure the correct handling of ownership percentages for both Group Shares and Proportion Shares so that subsequent consolidation tasks such as consolidation of investments and proportional integration of FS items work accurately.

Below are some SAP Standard Guidance and Community Consensus for your consumption:

  • You should enter the percentage of ownership, in both Task 2140 Enter Group Shares PL30 which covers the groupтАЩs shares for consolidation of investments and in Task 2145 you should Enter Proportion Shares % PL30 if your process or configuration leverages a custom task for proportional shares.
  • Please note, entering it in only one may cause subsequent tasks for example CoI task, proportional integration, not to process shares or investments correctly.
  • According to SAP documentation and user experience, entering the percentages in both places ensures that consolidation methods, eliminations and FS item postings are handled accurately for proportionately consolidated units and for correct calculation of ownership for downstream tasks.

 

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Outbound Delivery is not updating in EWM system it is...
entry.content:
Hello @Mahavir 

Thank you for highlighting the issue with Outbound Delivery (OBD) being stuck in the queue for the Stock Transport Order (STO) process between your EWM-managed (M300) and IM-managed (W304) plants in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Outbound Delivery is stuck in the queue for an STO from the EWM-managed M300 plant to the IM-managed W304 plant. The error states:
тАЬNo business partner found for ERP partner 0000000000 (role: SP) (Message no. /SCWM/ERPINTEGRATION053)тАЭ

Precise Diagnosis and Cloud-Related Actions

Business Partner Mapping in Public Cloud WM:

    • In S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, every customer and vendor involved in warehouse processes must have a corresponding Business Partner (BP) record with the correct roles, particularly Ship-To Party.
    • The integration expects either automatic or manual creation of BPs using Fiori apps like Manage Business Partner, ensuring that the ERP partner numbers match a BP with role SP in your warehouse organisational structure.

Master Data Synchronisation:

    • Verify that the partner number example 0000000000 in your error exists as a Business Partner with the Ship-To role in your Public Cloud tenant.
    • Use the Manage Business Partner Fiori app to verify and create or edit BPs as required.

Queue Reprocessing:

    • After fixing the missing BP, use the queue monitor app in Fiori to reprocess the stuck Outbound Delivery queue.
    • This is a standard procedure for resolving master data integration issues in Public Cloud, similar to private or on-premise solutionsтАФwith comparable process logic but using public cloud tools and apps.

References and Judgement:

    • Please check out the SAP Help Portal documentation for Warehouse Management in S/4HANA Cloud, public, itтАЩs a great resource to help you get started edition
      Warehouse Management тАУ SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
    • SAP Community also confirms BP mapping requirements and error resolution
      SAP Extended Warehouse Management FAQ Series тАУ Cloud
    • SAP Learning offers a complete journey for warehouse management configuration and troubleshooting in the cloud:
      SAP Learning тАУ Implement SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for Warehouse Management

Summary:

  • The error points to missing BP master data for your STO delivery partner.
  • Maintain BPs using Fiori apps, ensure roles and partner numbers are correctly mapped.
  • Reprocess the queue after correction.
  • These steps and requirements are standard for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Warehouse Management, based on embedded EWM principles.

Please inform me if you require any additional information.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Reference User Type Mapping To New User - GRC
entry.content:
Hi @Prashanth85 

Thank you for your question.

In SAP, a type L reference user is typically used to assign additional authorizations to other users by mapping roles or profiles. By associating the reference user to a type A dialog user, you allow the latter to inherit the authorizations assigned to the reference user, facilitating authorization management and compliance.

Below are the technical Feasibility:

  • SAP GRC ARM workflow can be configured to provision a new SAP user and, as part of the workflow, map the required reference user during the provisioning process.
  • During user creation or change in GRC ARM, you can set the reference user in the user master record SU01 via workflow, either through custom fields or by automating the assignment in BRF+ rules or MSMP workflow actions.
  • SAP supports this configuration and there are documented experiences in the community confirming successful setups for mapping type L reference users to type A users in user provisioning flows.

Here are insightful key points:

  • This mapping ensures that compliance, SOD and risk analysis leverage the reference user permissions as part of the access provisioning.
  • The process can be customized to your organizationтАЩs governance needs within the multi-stage or multi-path workflow and Business Rule Framework.
  • Make sure that GRC auto-provisioning and connector configurations allow reference user assignments during the request creation or approval stage.

For detailed setup, refer to your workflow configuration in MSMP and BRF+ for the user provisioning path.

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP certificate not received after passing the certif...
entry.content:
Hi @Koustav_Sarkar 

If you have passed your SAP certification exam for SAP Certified Associate SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, Management Accounting on August 10, 2025, but have not received your digital badge or certificate, here is what you should do:

The common Reasons for Delay

  • Digital badges and certificates are typically issued within 24 to 48 hours after exam completion, provided your SAP Universal ID setup is correct with a linked recovery email.
  • Sometimes, it can take a few business days up to a week in rare cases.
  • If you already raised a support ticket and haven't received a response, it is possible there is a backlog or technical issue.

What You Should Check and Do

  1. Confirm your SAP Universal ID
    • Make sure you have a valid SAP Universal ID set up and that your recovery or personal email is linked.
    • Do not register a new Universal ID if you already have one instead, link any new email to your existing account.
  2. Check you Junk or Spam Folders
    • Look for emails from SAP Learning Hub or Credly which is the platform SAP uses for badges in all your inbox folders.
  3. SAP Learning Portal
    • Go to your Certifications page on the SAP Learning portal. Sometimes you can access your certification record directly there, even if the badge email is delayed.
  4. Raise an Incident in the Correct Category
    • If you need status or technical help regarding the badge or certificate, create a ticket in the User Support Center under the Digital Badge service category and the Certification incident category.
    • Mention your certification ID, exam date, and existing ticket number for reference.
  5. Contacts and Escalation
    • For urgent cases especially when previous tickets go unanswered, try reaching out via SAPтАЩs official certification support or use social channels such as the SAP Learning Community.
    • Sometimes, posting on the SAP Learning Q&A forum can speed up responses as moderators escalate unresolved cases.

 

I hope this provides the necessary details. 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP PO WSSE Security in SOAP adapter
entry.content:
Hi @jakob_steen-petersen 

To send the Username and Password in the SOAP Header WS-Security UsernameToken using the SOAP receiver adapter in SAP Process Orchestration (PO), you should use the WS-Security configuration in the SOAP communication channel.

Steps I suggest you should take:

  1. Open the SOAP Receiver Communication Channel.
  2. Go to the Module tab.
  3. Add the WS-Security Adapter Module:
    • For SAP PO, add the standard module com.sap.aii.security.lib - SecurityModule.
    • Configure the module so it adds the UsernameToken to the outbound SOAP message.
  4. Set your WS-Security Parameters:
    • In the channel or module parameters, set the following where available:
      • wsse.username: your username
      • wsse.password: your password
      • action: UsernameToken
    • These properties ensure that SAP PO generates and inserts the required XML in the <soap:Header>.
  5. Alternatively, you can use manual header injection only if automatic module is not feasible:
    • Use the Request Response Bean and a custom XSLT or Java mapping to add the WS-Security header.
    • This is less typical standard function via WS-Security module is preferred.

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

 

Configure the SOAP (SOAP 1.x) Receiver Adapter

Migrate SOAP Axis (WS-Security) from SAP Process Orchestration(PO) to Cloud Integration(CI)

Configure User Authentication on SOAP Receiver Adapter

entry.title: Re: Production process
entry.content:
I could see some of the key challenges in your business process

  • Standard production logic assumes 1:1 input-output: If you order 2 pieces of 2m, SAP assumes you need 2 full rods unless you explicitly model the cutting logic.
  • Material master UoM limitations: Using meters vs. pieces can cause confusion in BOMs and routing.
  • Excess material reuse: SAP doesnтАЩt automatically track leftover segments unless modeled explicitly.

You're absolutely right;  this is the most scalable and cloud-compatible approach.

  • Base UoM: Use PIECE for the rod (e.g., 1 piece = 6 meters).
  • Batch Characteristic: Define a characteristic like Length_in_Meters and assign it to the batch class.
  • When cutting, create two new batches:

V001X1000M тЖТ Batch with 1 meter
V001X5000M тЖТ Batch with 5 meters (excess)

This allows you to track exact lengths per batch, avoid creating multiple material masters for each cut size and can reuse leftover segments intelligently

Instead of standard production, consider modeling this as a rework or conversion process:

  • Create a custom production order type (e.g., тАЬCutting OrderтАЭ).
  • Input: 1 piece of V001X6000M
  • Output: 1 piece of V001X1000M + 1 piece of V001X5000M
  • Use backflushing or manual goods movements to reflect the cut

This avoids BOM complexity and lets you control the flow more flexibly.

entry.title: Re: Factory Calendar configuration- Not able to create TR...
entry.content:
SCAL is client-dependent. Changes made via transaction SCAL (e.g., creating public holidays, holiday calendars, factory calendars) are not automatically linked to a transport request. For Golden Clients, in many SAP landscapes, the Golden Client is set up as a customizing client with no transport layer, or transport creation is restricted for certain objects like calendars.

If you're on S/4HANA Public Cloud, use SSCUI ID 180007 to configure and distribute calendar data. For more information, go through this blog 

Ask your Basis team to enable transport recording for SCAL changes. Use transaction SCAL, make changes, and then use Transport button to create TR manually. This may require authorization changes or client settings update

entry.title: Re: Tracking customer-owned RMAs in ECC
entry.content:
Some of the options which you can explore

Create a non-valuated dummy material to represent the RMA in transit. Post a goods issue from the GR plant using movement type 551E (scrapping customer-owned stock) or custom movement type. Post a goods receipt in the repair plant using 501E (receipt of customer-owned stock). This simulates the transfer and lets you track the RMA in the second plant. This doesnтАЩt move the actual stock but gives visibility and audit trail. YouтАЩll need to manually reconcile quantities.

Use a Z-table or Custom Report for RMA Location Tracking. Here create a simple Z-table to log RMA number, Customer, Material, GR plant Repair plant, Current status. Update this table manually or via a lightweight enhancement in MIGO or MB1B. Use it for reporting and tracking without changing core logistics flows.

Use Batch Classification with Plant info. Assign a batch number to each RMA item. Use batch characteristics to tag the current physical plant. Even if the material stays in the same SAP plant, you can reflect its actual location via classification.

Use Stock Transport Order (STO) with Non-Valuated Stock. If your system allows it, create a Stock Transport Order between plants using non-valuated customer-owned stock. This requires configuration to allow STOs for special stock тАШEтАЩ, which may be limited in ECC. If not feasible, simulate the STO using manual postings and tracking.

What S/4HANA will offer you is when you move to S/4HANA, this entire process becomes much cleaner with Advanced Returns Management (ARM):

  • You can create return orders that track the RMA from receipt to inspection to repair.
  • ARM supports cross-plant logistics, including repair in a different plant.
  • You get full document flow, status tracking, and integration with Quality Management and Warehouse Management.

entry.title: Re: safety stock caluclation in VM - Automatic reorder po...
entry.content:
Some of the reasons why the values could be different are

SAP rounds intermediate values (MAD, W, SS) differently than manual Excel calculations. Even small decimal differences can shift the final reorder point.

YouтАЩve used 30 days as forecast period consistently, but SAP might adjust this based on calendar days vs. workdays. If your planned delivery time is 15 calendar days, and SAP treats forecast period as 30 workdays, W becomes skewed.

SAP may recalculate MAD dynamically based on the forecast horizon and consumption variability. Your MAD is fixed at 41, but SAP might adjust it slightly depending on the forecast model used (e.g., constant vs. trend).

What you can do is check the R value SAP uses for 99% SL. If itтАЩs slightly higher than 2.33, your SS will be higher. Validate W by confirming if SAP is using calendar days or workdays for forecast period and lead time. Review Forecast Model in MP30: If itтАЩs set to automatic model selection, SAP might switch between constant/trend models, affecting MAD. Use Transaction MD04 to inspect how SAP calculates the reorder point and safety stock in real time.

entry.title: Re: Task list operations selection within PM orders
entry.content: In ECC6, the only partial workaround is via Extras тЖТ Settings тЖТ Default Values in IW31/IW32. You can enable тАЬOperation selectтАЭ and тАЬWork center selectionтАЭ. This gives a basic popup for selecting operations, but still lacks search/filter or banking capabilities. ThereтАЩs no standard enhancement in ECC6 that introduces a search bar or operation banking. You can consider exploring custom screens or user exits, but these require development effort and donтАЩt scale well.

entry.title: Re: Complex Multi-Rater Performance Rating Overall Calculations in SAP SuccessFactors Integration Ce
entry.content:
@IVR1  Hi, sorry for the delay because I generally login SAP community weekly.

Regarding your question, I believe that normalizing the score is not an appropriate approach. In fact, it is impractical, as assigning a precise proportion of competency requirements to each job role is not feasible. Since different roles demand varying levels of competency, it is essential to take job level into consideration when making comparisons across employees at different levels.

In my view, it would be more meaningful in this case to evaluate the competency score gap rather than focusing solely on the absolute score. Additionally, it would be advisable to include the job role, expected score and rating as a point of reference in the report.

If you would discuss it further, you could contact me in LinkedIn. Thanks.
